com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.objects.data_import

Class DataBucketBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.objects.data_import.DataBucketBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class DataBucketBean
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A very important bean that describes how a bucket gets and stores its data
    Author:
    acp
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DataBucketBean.MasterEnrichmentType 
      static class  DataBucketBean.Template
      Encapsulates a template object used to create this bucket Ie the information in the list of templates (ids + subs) is sufficient to recreate an identical bucket

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected DataBucketBean() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String _id()
      The management DB id of the bucket (unchangeable, unlike the bucket name)
      Set<String> aliases()
      A list of bucket aliases - each alias defines a multi-bucket (as an alternative to specifically creating one, which is also possible)
      AnalyticThreadBean analytic_thread()
      If this is specified, then the bucket is an analytic thread (it can also import/enrich data, though that's less usual)
      List<EnrichmentControlMetadataBean> batch_enrichment_configs()
      A list of enrichments that are applied to the bucket after ingestion via batch
      EnrichmentControlMetadataBean batch_enrichment_topology()
      Instead of a list of modules that are applied to the bucket by the core, it is possible to pass a single enrichment topology that is applied - this gives the developers much more control Currently there is no batch enrichment topology supported however, so this is a placeholder.
      Date created()
      When this bucket was first created
      Map<String,String> data_locations()
      A list of logical locations against each of the schemas - the string therein will only make sense to the current schema implementation
      DataSchemaBean data_schema()
      The data schema applied to all objects ingested into this bucket
      String description()
      A user editable description
      String display_name()
      A user editable display name for the bucket - no enforced uniqueness.
      List<String> external_emit_paths()
      Users must declare up front which output paths to which they will allow external emitting (glob format, ie * and ** supported) This helps with avoiding inadvertent mistakes and also means that graphs of bucket interactions can be generated more accurately If you really want to spray externalEmits everywhere, you can always set "/**"
      String full_name()
      The bucket name as a path relative to the root path (starting with /) - is enforced unique across the cluster eg /project1/web_crawl_1, /project2/log_files/netflow_logs
      List<HarvestControlMetadataBean> harvest_configs()
      A list of configurations that are specific to the technology that describe the precise import functionality applied by the data import manager
      String harvest_technology_name_or_id()
      The name or id of the harvest technology associated with this bucket
      Boolean lock_to_nodes()
      If disabled (default: true) then each new harvest call (or analytics calls for pure analytic threads) is mapped to a new node If enabled (ie the default), then once the harvester/analytic (/set of harvesters for multi node) has handled a harvest/analytics call, all future calls will be sent to that same node For harvesters, lock_to_nodes is the standard behavior because they are normally external processes that are launched and persist, vs (eg) stateless calls to distributed frameworks NOTE: because setting this incorrectly would be so disastrous, this flag has to match the IHarvestTechnology.applyNodeAffinity call (or the IAnalyticsTechnology call for pure analytic threads), or the bucket will generate errors and not run.
      DataBucketBean.MasterEnrichmentType master_enrichment_type()
      Only objects from the specified (potentially empty) enrichment route are stored Objects from the other enrichment route are broadcast to listening analytic or access modules and if not subscribed to are discarded.
      Map<String,Object> misc_properties()
      Serves no functional purpose, just present eg to copy temporary blocks of JSON around during manual editing of sources eg in the UI Can also be used for app-specific attributes that aren't displayed as part of system metadata
      Date modified()
      When this bucket was last modified
      Set<String> multi_bucket_children()
      A list of buckets in this multi-buckets (Nested multi-buckets are currently not supported)
      Boolean multi_node_enabled()
      Determines whether the harvester associated with this bucket should run on a single node, or multiples nodes - regardless, will only run on nodes meeting the rules specified in node_list_rules() If not set then defaults to single node NOTE: that inherently distributed harvesters (eg Storm/Hadoop/Spark) are set to false, since they only need be started from a single node This is for single-node technologies (eg a random external process) that you can "auto distribute" across multiple nodes (and feed via round-robin)
      List<String> node_list_rules()
      Each item is either a glob or regex (format: /regex/flags) which is compared against the nodes' hostnames to determine whether the associated bucket can run on that hostname If a string is prefaced with the '-' then it is an exclude rule; if there is no prefix, or the prefix is '+' then it is an include rule.
      String owner_id()
      The management DB id of the bucket's owner.
      String poll_frequency()
      The frequency with which the harvester is polled for this bucket.
      List<EnrichmentControlMetadataBean> streaming_enrichment_configs()
      A list of enrichments that are applied to the bucket after ingestion via streaming
      EnrichmentControlMetadataBean streaming_enrichment_topology()
      Instead of a list of modules that are applied to the bucket by the core, it is possible to pass a single enrichment topology that is applied - this gives the developers much more control Currently the only streaming topology supported is Apache STORM
      List<DataBucketBean> sub_buckets()
      It is possible for a single bucket to write to multiple "collections" using sub_buckets All non-explicitly-specified attributes (apart from full_name) are inherited from the parent full_name must be exactly one path below the parent's full_name, and mustn't "collide" with any existinb buckets Nesting within sub_buckets is not (currently) supported
      Set<String> tags()
      A list of bucket tags - for display/search only
      List<DataBucketBean.Template> templates()
      A list of templates that was used to generate this bucket

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public String full_name()

      • display_name

        public String display_name()
        A user editable display name for the bucket - no enforced uniqueness. Is auto-generated from the lowest path name if not specified.
        Returns:
        the display_name

      • description

        public String description()
        A user editable description
        Returns:
        the description

        public String owner_id()
        The management DB id of the bucket's owner. Auto generated by the system.
        Returns:
        the owner_id

      • tags

        public Set<String> tags()
        A list of bucket tags - for display/search only
        Returns:
        the bucket_aliases

      • poll_frequency

        public String poll_frequency()
        The frequency with which the harvester is polled for this bucket.
        Returns:
        the poll_frequency in some human readable format ("every 5 minutes", "hourly", "3600" etc)

      • aliases

        public Set<String> aliases()
        A list of bucket aliases - each alias defines a multi-bucket (as an alternative to specifically creating one, which is also possible)
        Returns:
        the bucket_aliases

      • multi_bucket_children

        public Set<String> multi_bucket_children()
        A list of buckets in this multi-buckets (Nested multi-buckets are currently not supported)
        Returns:
        multi_group_children

      • sub_buckets

        public List<DataBucketBean> sub_buckets()
        It is possible for a single bucket to write to multiple "collections" using sub_buckets All non-explicitly-specified attributes (apart from full_name) are inherited from the parent full_name must be exactly one path below the parent's full_name, and mustn't "collide" with any existinb buckets Nesting within sub_buckets is not (currently) supported
        Returns:
        the list of sub buckets

      • harvest_technology_name_or_id

        public String harvest_technology_name_or_id()
        The name or id of the harvest technology associated with this bucket
        Returns:
        the harvest_technology_name_or_id

      • harvest_configs

        public List<HarvestControlMetadataBean> harvest_configs()
        A list of configurations that are specific to the technology that describe the precise import functionality applied by the data import manager
        Returns:
        the harvest_configs

      • multi_node_enabled

        public Boolean multi_node_enabled()
        Determines whether the harvester associated with this bucket should run on a single node, or multiples nodes - regardless, will only run on nodes meeting the rules specified in node_list_rules() If not set then defaults to single node NOTE: that inherently distributed harvesters (eg Storm/Hadoop/Spark) are set to false, since they only need be started from a single node This is for single-node technologies (eg a random external process) that you can "auto distribute" across multiple nodes (and feed via round-robin)
        Returns:
        whether the harvester associated with this bucket should run on a single node, or multiples nodes

      • node_list_rules

        public List<String> node_list_rules()
        Each item is either a glob or regex (format: /regex/flags) which is compared against the nodes' hostnames to determine whether the associated bucket can run on that hostname If a string is prefaced with the '-' then it is an exclude rule; if there is no prefix, or the prefix is '+' then it is an include rule.
        Returns:
        the node list rules

      • lock_to_nodes

        public Boolean lock_to_nodes()
        If disabled (default: true) then each new harvest call (or analytics calls for pure analytic threads) is mapped to a new node If enabled (ie the default), then once the harvester/analytic (/set of harvesters for multi node) has handled a harvest/analytics call, all future calls will be sent to that same node For harvesters, lock_to_nodes is the standard behavior because they are normally external processes that are launched and persist, vs (eg) stateless calls to distributed frameworks NOTE: because setting this incorrectly would be so disastrous, this flag has to match the IHarvestTechnology.applyNodeAffinity call (or the IAnalyticsTechnology call for pure analytic threads), or the bucket will generate errors and not run.
        Returns:
        whether the bucket is locked to a set of nodes once run for the first time

      • batch_enrichment_configs

        public List<EnrichmentControlMetadataBean> batch_enrichment_configs()
        A list of enrichments that are applied to the bucket after ingestion via batch
        Returns:
        the enrichment_configs

      • batch_enrichment_topology

        public EnrichmentControlMetadataBean batch_enrichment_topology()
        Instead of a list of modules that are applied to the bucket by the core, it is possible to pass a single enrichment topology that is applied - this gives the developers much more control Currently there is no batch enrichment topology supported however, so this is a placeholder.
        Returns:
        the enrichment_configs

      • streaming_enrichment_configs

        public List<EnrichmentControlMetadataBean> streaming_enrichment_configs()
        A list of enrichments that are applied to the bucket after ingestion via streaming
        Returns:
        the enrichment_configs

      • streaming_enrichment_topology

        public EnrichmentControlMetadataBean streaming_enrichment_topology()
        Instead of a list of modules that are applied to the bucket by the core, it is possible to pass a single enrichment topology that is applied - this gives the developers much more control Currently the only streaming topology supported is Apache STORM
        Returns:
        the enrichment_configs

        public DataBucketBean.MasterEnrichmentType master_enrichment_type()
        Only objects from the specified (potentially empty) enrichment route are stored Objects from the other enrichment route are broadcast to listening analytic or access modules and if not subscribed to are discarded.
        Returns:

        Returns:
